interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Legend of the Viking Cross Dvd! Feature Film for Families
Review Date: 2014/02/10
Store: Format: Unknown Binding
Categories: Movies & TV, Movies
Product Description: ['"If your brother needs you, you can\'t refuse him," Angeline tells Awasis, urging him to help their friend, Jamie, who has embarked on a dangerous journey. However, Jamie is guiding a treasure hunter named Connolly to a place Awasis never wants to see again -- the Viking grave. Connolly is nothing but a grave robber as far as Awasis is concerned. That\'s why he didn\'t hire on as one of Connolly\'s guides. Unfortunately, the lure of fame and fortune proves irresistible to Jamie. He is soon caught up in the hunt for a jewel-laden cross made of white gold, supposedly buried in the ancient Viking crypt. Jamie realizes too late that the cost of his perilous adventure may be far too high. If Jamie is to survive, Awasis must overcome his hurt feelings and team up with Angeline to rescue their "brother."']
Average Rating: 4.9
Product Details: {'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'Package Dimensions': '7.1 x 5.42 x 0.58 inches; 2.93 Ounces', 'Media Format': 'DVD'}
Review Text: This is a great movie if you like clean decent family entertainment for your self and family. I gave this as a gift as well.
Review Title: good family movie
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------

Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Drama
["When a lonely ex-New Yorker moves into the home of a rural senior to act as a hospice worker, the two initially couldn't seem to be less alike. However, as time passes, the two find much kinship including a lost child. Slowly the two build a bond and learn about life."]

Lost in the Barrens
Nicholas Shields  (Actor),     Evan Adams  (Actor),     Michael J.F. Scott  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    Unrated    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Kids & Family
['"Your strength and your courage will be shown in the good works that you do for others." When the trust fund keeping orphaned Jamie in his upper-class boarding school runs out, he must cross the continent to live with his Uncle Angus, a fur trapper, in the Canadian wilderness. Disobeying his father, Awasis, a native boy, and Jamie explore the breathtaking territory on their own. A careless accident makes the unlikely pair realize that their disobedience could cost them their lives. A loyal friendship is sparked as they begin to their vast cultural differences in a different light. But will that light burn brightly enough to lead them safely home?']

Slow Moe, A Feature Films for Families DVD
Scotty Leavenworth  (Actor),     Amanda Michalka  (Actor),     Tim Nelson  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    G    Format: Unknown Binding
Movies & TV, Movies
['(2009) Marvin Mobley dreams of becoming a great baseball player but no matter how much he practices or how hard he tries, he doesn’t improve. His dream finally comes true when he finds a mysterious pair of glasses that turns him into the greatest baseball player his town has ever seen. After the glasses disappear, Marvin doesn’t believe he can play but with the support of his team he learns that winning doesn’t mean anything if you can’t be proud of how you play the game.']

profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Genres of Interest:** The user has a strong preference for drama, especially stories that explore deep emotional connections and personal growth. Their interests continue to embrace family-oriented narratives that promote adventure, education, and a wider understanding of different perspectives.

- **Content Format:** They enjoy classic cinema, particularly VHS purchases, while also exploring modern formats like DVD. This reflects their appreciation for both nostalgic and contemporary storytelling.

- **Gift-Giving:** The user carefully selects family-friendly films that cater to a wide age range, enhancing shared enjoyment and fostering family bonding experiences.

- **Review Behavior:** Their reviews are generally positive, with a recent focus on family-centric films. They maintain a discerning approach to filmmaking quality, evidenced by their enthusiastic endorsement of films that deliver clean, decent entertainment suitable for families.

- **Personal Values:** The user values narratives that emphasize connection, compassion, and the journey of life, resonating with themes centered on relationships, personal struggles, friendship, and cultural understanding. 

The recent interaction highlights their continued commitment to family-friendly content, particularly films that are engaging yet appropriate for all ages. Overall, they exhibit a strong inclination toward heartfelt storytelling that promotes positivity, connection, and valuable life lessons, reinforcing their role as a thoughtful curator of family entertainment.
